messages.subject: Re: Starting to read
messages.msgSnippet: ... unschooled (or eclectically homeschooled with a real unschooling slant) girl we ve known well has begun reading fluently (i.e., pretty much anything they
messages.messageBody:
>>>Ya think? My mileage varies, I guess... at least for girls. Almost every
unschooled (or eclectically homeschooled with a real unschooling slant)
girl we've known well has begun reading fluently (i.e., pretty much
anything they can put their hands on)I'd like to hear others' experiences.
Dar>>>>


Guess my girls are more like boys?..My oldest dd learned to read in
school..during first grade..very traditional. But my middle dd..totally
homeschooled and left to her own timing.. didn't read fluently until age 9
or almost 10.. now she is 12 and reads as well as I do. My youngest dd is
7yrs and has no interest in reading yet...not even in being read to..she is
way too busy with artwork, animals and outside stuff.
Julie in MO
